newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BRIGHTON FEUD DRAWS TO A CLOSE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BRIGHTON FEUD DRAWS TO A CLOSE.

text.p: A bitter 21-month internal crisis within English third division club Brighton appeared to be resolved on Tuesday.
The dispute, which has sparked several angry pitch invasions at the Goldstone ground, was settled by independent negotiators with the decision to build a new 15,000-seat stadium.
The bottom-of-the-table club, who have to move from their ground at the end of the season, also plan to spend two million pounds ($3.3 million) on strengthening their player reserves.
Local businessman Dick Knight was named the club's new chairman, replacing Dick Archer.
Archer, the focus of much of the fans' ire, has agreed to stay away from Brighton's final game at the Goldstone ground on Saturday.
